meanings.sent1: The labouring student stayed up late to finish the project.
meanings.sent2: She admired her father's labouring efforts to provide for the family.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel made a labouring attempt to reach the acorn on the high branch.
meanings.sent4: The old car made a labouring climb up the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The labouring ant tirelessly carried food back to its nest.

meanings.definition: Engaged in manual or industrial work
meanings.sent1: The labouring workers toiled under the hot sun all day.
meanings.sent2: The factory was filled with the sound of labouring machinery.
meanings.sent3: The chef's labouring hands swiftly prepared the delicious meal.
meanings.sent4: The labouring bees buzzed around the blooming flowers.
meanings.sent5: The labouring farmer harvested the ripe crops in the field.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of effort or strain
meanings.sent1: Her labouring breaths indicated she had been running for a while.
meanings.sent2: The labouring hiker struggled to climb the steep mountain trail.
meanings.sent3: The cat made a labouring attempt to catch the elusive mouse.
meanings.sent4: The labouring engine sputtered before finally starting.
meanings.sent5: His labouring voice revealed his exhaustion after the long speech.

meanings.sent1: The labouring ship battled against the strong waves in the storm.
meanings.sent2: The labouring turtle slowly made its way across the sandy beach.
meanings.sent3: The labouring snail inched its way along the garden path.
meanings.sent4: The labouring caterpillar struggled to climb the tall plant.
meanings.sent5: The labouring train chugged along the tracks, delayed by the snow.
